topic: Time Blocking for Deep Work: A Practical Guide for Students
target_audience: university and high school students juggling classes, work, and projects

refs.content: Argues for long, uninterrupted focus intervals; practical rituals and attention hygiene for cognitively demanding tasks.
Foundational concept of flow; conditions for deep engagement relevant to structuring time blocks.
Heavy media multitaskers show poorer task-switching performance; supports limiting context switches during blocks.

special_instructions: Provide a 5-step setup with templates (daily/weekly); include contingency planning and a 'fail-safe' minimum block.
